TEXT: The applicant , Mr ORG , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the Court by Mr GPE GPE , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE police officers arrested the applicant on suspicion of membership of the ORG .
On DATE ORG ( sıkıyönetim askeri mahkemesi ) ordered the applicant 's detention pending trial .

On DATE ORG filed an indictment with ORG charging the applicant under articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Criminal Code with membership of the ORG and undertaking actions aimed at separating a portion of the territories under the sovereignty of the ORG from the administration of the ORG .
On an unspecified date the applicant appointed a lawyer of his own choice to represent him throughout the domestic criminal proceedings .
On DATE ORG found the applicant guilty of offences under LAW and CARDINAL and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment . The applicant appealed .
On DATE ORG ( askeri yargıtay ) quashed the judgment of DATE holding that there was insufficient evidence for the applicant 's conviction .
On DATE the applicant was released pending trial .
Following promulgation of the PERSON of DATE , which abolished the jurisdiction of the martial law courts , ORG acquired jurisdiction over the case and the case - file was sent to it .
On DATE ORG acquitted the applicant of the charges .
On DATE the judgment of ORG was served on the applicant 's representative .
On DATE the judgment acquitting the applicant became final as neither the applicant nor the public prosecutor had appealed against it before the statutory time - limit .
On DATE the applicant appointed a new lawyer , who is his representative in the proceedings before the ORG .
On DATE the now final judgment was served on the applicant 's new lawyer upon his request .
On DATE the applicant filed a claim with ORG under PERSON no . CARDINAL requesting compensation for his unjustified detention on remand .
On DATE ORG awarded compensation to the applicant .
On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of the firstinstance court .
